page.title: 03ORIGINS OF ATWORTH
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY A community has existed here for hundreds of years,no doubt having its origins in Roman times.The first recorded mention is in the year 1001 when{ATTENWRTH_AETTA's farm gives indication that the land was settled and farmed. A Roman road bisects the block and numerous tracks lead off this.These no doubt served the Roman villa at blocks eastern extreme.The remains of the villa have been excavated but as they lie approx 6 inches below soil level,they have been damaged over the years. It has been estimated that the villa had a population of around 120. Various coins have been found in the vicinity.The earliest dating from the 4th Century.
